intro: Koanophyllon oligadenium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, typical of the dandelion genus. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Koanophyllon oligadenium is adapted to arid environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils with minimal water availability.
